alert.note: Alert for Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 9:28AM EDT until September 05 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Pike County, Ohio. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Waverly, Piketon, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Sinking Spring, Idaho, Elm Grove, Buchanan, Lake White, Ladd, Wakefield, Poplar Grove, Pike County Airport and Omega.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
